about_the_game:
WARNING: You don't have to be dead to play this game. But it can help.



We all knew it was going to happen sooner or later: zombies took over the planet and their victory was absolute.
But zombie society still has its problems, with rampant crime topping the list.

Take on the role of undead private detective Margh and solve bizarre and unconventional mysteries with the help of his willing but unwieldy assistant, Ghvnn, in this humorous and wacky graphic adventure that combines point-and-click mechanics with an elaborate “deaduction” system.

Visit crime scenes, interrogate decomposing suspects and quirky witnesses, solve puzzles, gather clues and use your brain (or what's left of it) to interpret them and arrive at each case's conclusion - hopefully the right one.



Among shady neuron dealers, the zombie mafia, clandestine gambling dens and mysterious thefts, Margh will have his work cut out for him.
Who knows, between one case and another he might even manage to unravel the greatest mystery of zombie society, the one that underlies its very establishment.
And maybe Ghvnn will succeed in quenching his insatiable hunger for brains - but that, perhaps, is too much to ask.

One thing is certain:

FEATURES

  • 4 cases to solve, each one more peculiar than the last
  • Intuitive "deaduction" system that will make you use your brain
  • simple and modern point-and-click interface
  • multiple endings
  • Instant translation from “Zombiesh” into English (be warned: zombies tend to say “brain” quite a lot)
  • In-game hint system
